node.title: California to ticket high-pollution trucks, lawn mowers
node.description: "What we're really talking about here is the smog ... that is making people sick and killing people," one advocate said of new regulations.

node.title: Review: For Once, Singing of Complete and Utter Clarity
node.description: “Voices of the Immaculate,” a new cantata by Kati Agocs performed on Thursday by Lucy Dhegrae, was entirely, word for word, lucid.

node.title: The Best Graphic Novels of 2021
node.description: This year’s crop of comics art included experimental storytelling and flights of stylistic fancy.

node.title: As Metro Pictures Closes, Its Founders Look Back
node.description: Janelle Reiring and Helene Winer on their landmark gallery, which introduced Cindy Sherman, Louise Lawler, Robert Longo and Richard Prince to the art world.

node.title: All Decked Out in Fir: The Intricacies of the Sidewalk Christmas Tree
node.description: “There’s a lot going on behind me selling Christmas trees on the street.”

node.title: Britain faces an Omicron wave, but it’s not clear how bad it’ll be.
node.description: By Megan Specia

node.title: ‘European Sovereignty’ on the Menu as Macron and Scholz Meet for Lunch
node.description: The new German chancellor made his first foreign stop in Paris, where the two leaders discussed a more independent, bolder Europe.

node.title: Vaccine Mandates Rekindle Fierce Debate Over Civil Liberties
node.description: Tougher requirements in some European nations have inspired pushback from angry citizens as leaders grapple with how far to go in the name of public health.

node.title: How and Where To See Ultrafast Comet Leonard at Its Closest Point to Earth This Weekend
node.description: Also known as C/2021 A1, the icy ball has spent the last 35,000 years traveling towards us—and viewing it this month is therefore a once-in-a-lifetime stargazing event.

node.title: LGBTQ Community in Tunisia Forcibly Outed to Public, Face Police Brutality: Activists
node.description: "Officers feel empowered to enact whatever form of violence they want, knowing that they will get away with it," said Rasha Younes of Human Rights Watch.

node.title: South Korean PM Says Country Could Take Extraordinary Measures as COVID Cases Soar
node.description: Though South Korea lessened its COVID-19 restrictions last month, a surge in cases and the looming Omicron variant have caused some restrictions to return.

node.title: 'Hypetags' Show Live Value of Your Sneakers—and the Internet Isn't Happy
node.description: TikTok users are not seeing the funny side of a viral video about the invention of digital price tags that you can clip onto sneaker laces.

node.title: Inflation Calculator: How to Track Price Rises As Inflation at Highest Since 1982
node.description: Prices for U.S. consumers jumped 6.8 percent in November compared with 12 months ago.

node.title: As Omicron Variant Spreads, COVID Cases Are Rising Fastest in These 5 States
node.description: Connecticut has seen a 123 percent rise in the number of daily cases over the past 14 days, making it the state where COVID cases are rising most quickly.

node.title: Florida Man Angry Over Neighbors' Parking Habits Uses Flamethrower at Occupied Car: Police
node.description: According to a neighbor, Andre Abrams frequently uses a flame thrower to scare off visitors from her home. "When he shoots it, it lights the whole road up."

node.title: 12-Year-old Florida Boy Accused of Bringing Slingshot, Rocks, Knives to School
node.description: The arrest of a Walter C. Young Middle School student coincides with a steep rise in threats against other schools across the country.

node.title: 650 Die at Border in First Year of Biden, 24 Percent More Than Peak Under Trump, Obama
node.description: This new peak in border crosser deaths come as migration across the Southwest border has experienced record highs.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse's Instagram Disabled Just Days After Being Reinstated
node.description: Teenager's social media accounts were reinstated following his acquittal of all charges last month.

node.title: 56 Economists Tout Benefits of Biden's Build Back Better Act Despite GOP Inflation Concerns
node.description: "Congress can alleviate some of the strain caused by inflation by passing the Build Back Better Act," the economists said.

node.title: N.Y. mandates masks at indoor public places that do not require vaccination
node.description: The measure is effective starting on Monday until January 15.

node.title: How Trump is shaping 2022 races in states he lost in 2020
node.description: "Some might call 2022 the revenge tour, but more accurately, President Trump is building the Republican Party through the interests of every MAGA voter for years to come," one Trump adviser said.

node.title: Astronaut's daughter, TV host to headline Blue Origin space flight
node.description: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin is launching its third sub-orbital passenger flight to the edge of space.

node.title: Daughter of the man who played golf on the moon is going to space
node.description: "I'm excited to kind of be following in my father's footsteps, for starters," said Laura Shepard Churchley, 60 years after her father, Alan Shepard, became the first American to fly in space.

node.title: Activist claims ex-U.S. officials hacked iPhone before she was jailed
node.description: Loujain al-Hathloul​ alleges the trio oversaw a project that hacked into her iPhone to track her location and steal information as part of broader surveillance efforts targeted at dissidents.

node.title: What to Cook This Weekend
node.description: Eric Kim’s new recipe for root-beer ham will deliver incredible results for the holiday.

node.title: A 21st-Century Emily Dickinson Finds a Home in the Archives
node.description: The Apple TV+ series “Dickinson” is donating scripts, props and other artifacts — including painstaking replicas of the poet’s manuscripts — to the Emily Dickinson Museum and Harvard University.

node.title: Better.com’s C.E.O. is ‘taking time off’ after firing 900 workers over Zoom.
node.description: The mortgage lender’s board announced the decision in a memo sent to staff, adding that the company had brought on a third-party firm to assess its leadership and culture.

node.title: U.S. Sanctions Liberia's Ex-Warlord, Senator Prince Johnson, for Alleged Corruption
node.description: Johnson challenged the U.S. government to give details about which specific administrations in Liberia had paid him corrupt fees.

node.title: Al-Qaida Attempting to Rebuild Presence in Afghanistan With U.S. Out, Commander Says
node.description: Marine Gen. Frank McKenzie said that the absence of American forces in Afghanistan has complicated efforts to monitor groups like al-Qaida.

node.title: Donald Trump Set For Lucrative History Tour, Despite Shows Not Selling Out
node.description: The former president will begin his four-date "History Tour" with former Fox News host Bill O'Reilly in Florida before moving onto Texas.
